sn55.32:1.1: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurture happiness.
sn55.32:1.3: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …
sn55.32:3.1: Furthermore, a noble disciple lives at home rid of the stain of stinginess, freely generous, open-handed, loving to let go, committed to charity, loving to give and to share.
sn55.32:3.2: This is the fourth kind of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurtures happiness.
sn55.32:3.3: These are the four kinds of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurture happiness.”
